column4: Hello. I asked before this question and I am asking today. I have a HP Pavilion dv7-1040 notebook computer. The notebook computer works very good on Ubuntu but I can't hear sound. The soundcard is HDA Intel. What can I do?
you can try adding the model=laptop or other model options to snd-hda-intel
depends; could be a problem in the mirrot
again; would help to see the exact error messages you are getting
sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude safe-upgrade
the instructions are pretty clear ... to paste into nano try the middle button.
or you can use gedit if you prefer. « gksudo gedit /etc/sysfs.conf »
I understand but what's the middle button? I didn't understand this.
unix is designed for a trhee button mouse
well i'm in the same position as you. either yo trust the blog post or not ...
I trust but it doesn't tell the place for copying to the file. I want to know this because I don't want to do a mistake.
Yes but I don't know the specific place.
the filenname tells you. directory /etc/ filename sysfs.conf
i bet that the lines on the file can be anywhere in it.
I understand so I will try to save under ''Examples'' are. I hope it will work.
